member.name: T:RegisterView
member.summary:
The BCM GPIO registers expose the data/direction/interrupt/etc functionality of pins. Each register is 64 bits, where each bit represents a logical register number.
For example, writing HIGH to register 20 would translate to (registerViewPointer).GPSET[0] | (1U << 20).

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.Drivers.RaspberryPi3LinuxDriver.GetPeripheralBaseAddress
member.summary: Returns the peripheral base address on the CPU bus of the raspberry pi based on the ranges set within the device tree.
member.remarks: The range examined in this method is essentially a mapping between where the peripheral base address on the videocore bus and its address on the cpu bus. The return value is 32bit (is in the first 4GB) even on 64 bit operating systems (debian / ubuntu tested) but may change in the future This method is based on bcm_host_get_peripheral_address() in libbcm_host which may not exist in all linux distributions.
member.returns: This returns the peripheral base address as a 32 bit address or 0xFFFFFFFF when in error.

member.remarks: This really feels like it needs a driver-based pattern, where each driver exposes a static method: public static bool IsSpecificToCurrentEnvironment { get; } The GpioController could use reflection to find all GpioDriver-derived classes and call this static method to determine if the driver considers itself to be the best match for the environment.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.GetPinMode
member.summary: Gets the current pin mode for the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.
member.returns: An enumeration value that indicates the current pin mode for the GPIO pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.IsPinModeSupported(System.Device.Gpio.PinMode)
member.summary: Gets whether the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin supports the specified pin mode.
member.param: The pin mode that you want to check for support.
member.returns: if the GPIO pin supports the pin mode that pinMode specifies; otherwise false. If you specify a pin mode for which this method returns when you call , generates an exception.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.SetPinMode(System.Device.Gpio.PinMode)
member.summary: Sets the pin mode of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.
member.param: An enumeration value that specifies pin mode to use for the GPIO pin. The pin mode specifies whether the pin is configured as an input or an output, and determines how values are driven onto the pin.
member.exception: The GPIO pin does not support the specified pin mode.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.Read
member.summary: Reads the current value of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin.
member.returns: The current value of the GPIO pin. If the pin is configured as an output, this value is the last value written to the pin.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.Write(System.Device.Gpio.PinValue)
member.summary: Drives the specified value onto the general purpose I/O (GPIO) pin according to the current pin mode for the pin if the pin is configured as an output, or updates the latched output value for the pin if the pin is configured as an input.
member.param:
The enumeration value to write to the GPIO pin.
If the GPIO pin is configured as an output, the method drives the specified value onto the pin according to the current pin mode for the pin.
If the GPIO pin is configured as an input, the method updates the latched output value for the pin. The latched output value is driven onto the pin when the configuration for the pin changes to output.
member.exception: This exception will be thrown on an attempt to write to a pin that hasn't been opened or is not configured as output.

member.name: E:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin changes, either because of an external stimulus when the pin is configured as an input, or when a value is written to the pin when the pin in configured as an output.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPin.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles the output of the general purpose I/O (GPIO) pin if the pin is configured as an output.

member.name: T:System.Device.ComponentInformation
member.summary: A class to provide informational data about system components and active drivers and bindings. An instance of this class is typically obtained by calling QueryComponentInformation on any supported object. member.name: T:System.Device.Spi.SpiMode
member.summary: Defines how data is synchronized between devices on a SPI bus. Clock Polarity (CPOL) determines if clock signal is low or high when in idle state. Clock Phase (CPHA) determines when data is sampled relative to the clock signal.

member.name: F:System.Device.Spi.SpiMode.Mode0
member.summary: CPOL 0, CPHA 0. Polarity is idled low and data is sampled on rising edge of the clock signal.

member.name: F:System.Device.Spi.SpiMode.Mode1
member.summary: CPOL 0, CPHA 1. Polarity is idled low and data is sampled on falling edge of the clock signal.

member.name: F:System.Device.Spi.SpiMode.Mode2
member.summary: CPOL 1, CPHA 0. Polarity is idled high and data is sampled on falling edge of the clock signal.

member.name: F:System.Device.Spi.SpiMode.Mode3
member.summary: CPOL 1, CPHA 1. Polarity is idled high and data is sampled on rising edge of the clock signal.

member.name: M:System.Device.SysFsHelpers.EnsureReadWriteAccessToPath(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures path can be read-write accessed or throws UnauthorizedAccessException. This method is meant to be used with sysfs drivers and access is checked for maximum period of 1 second. Waiting period is used to give time for udev to update permissions.
member.param: Path to be checked for access

member.name: M:System.Device.SysFsHelpers.EnsureDirectoryExistsAndHasReadWriteAccess(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures directory exists and can be read-write accessed or throws UnauthorizedAccessException. This method is meant to be used with sysfs drivers and exception is thrown if progress is not made for one second. Waiting period is used to give time for udev to create directory or update permissions.
member.param: Directory to be checked for access
